name: Aston Waikiki Sunset

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom apt. We were upgraded to an ocean view room. Hotel is in the process of being renovated, and it needs it badly. The rooms are very dated, but large and clean and everything in them that you need. Also, has a good size balcony.
reviews.title: Great location and plenty of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big outdoor area, with pool, tennis court and bbq areas.
reviews.title: Just oke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Short walk to Waikiki Beach and close to shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Loved the staff and location

reviews.text: Really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location - Bad housekeeping

reviews.text: Ofcourse we have seen the reviews but you should be there before you can judge. First of all, we booked an ocean view but due to renovations we got a mountainview. (they only renovate 2 floors at a time) So that was weird, there must be more floors with ocean view. So my husband went downstairs, he was not happy so to speak. We got a oceanview but our view was blocked by the building in front of us.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

likes.liked: — Price was good, The room was better than expected
likes.disliked: — Room was a little run-down around the edges

reviews.text: I actually won a trip, personally I never win anything. It was through Apple Vacations and I was allowed a set amount and told I could go anywhere I wanted. My fiance and I decided on Hawaii, well she did. As we looked at the Hotels and using the Apple Vacations web page, we found nice hotels along the beach that would cover what we had to spend. However when we searched 2 blocks back, we found the Waikiki Sunset, it was perfect for us, as we were able to take her sister and brother-in-law along, and we split the difference 4 ways. I read the reviews and the comments, some where not so nice. When we go to Disney, we stay at the All Star Resorts, how much time do you spend in your room. Same here, if I want to stay in a room, I could stay at home. The rooms were "Dated", as one reviewer put it. To me they were vintage and added to my vacation. All the Staff were excellent, and I saw Security several times making rounds. I read a review stating the elevators were slow. Well 38 floors, transporters aren't availble as of yet, I thought they did pretty good. They do have 2 outside Weber gas grills, which were not only clean, but great for the steaks and burgers. We did not use the pool, as we have one at home, so we went to the beach. The water is that clear, you forget you are in the ocean until you get a mouth full or open your eyes. The way the "Fish" walls are constructed, I actually had Trumpet fish at my feet along with Nemo. These rooms are Condos and have kitchens. If you belong to a Sams Club, get your food there, and your other needs at Walmart. The ABC Stores are great and you will pay 2.50 for 1/2 pound of butter and 14.99 for a 12 pack of Bud. Finally the question is, would you return. The answer is, yes; and I am in 2 years. This time I will be bringing my son, his wife and 2 grand children along, and we will be at the Waikiki Sunset. Sorry that I have no photo's to post. My computer won't accept my chip. Since we live near Hershey Pa. we brought Hershey Bars and gave them out instead of money for tips, there went over great.
reviews.title: I was happy

likes.disliked: — The people around me that complained about every little thing, those self rightous drama queens.

reviews.text: Me and my girlfriends visited Hawaii in August of 2008....First of all, if your travel agent tells you that this is a "CONDO STYLE" apartment that accomodates 5 people- THAT IS A LIE! This place really sucked- I mean really....Every morning, the hallways stunk like fish- this is no joke- We had to wait for the elevator minimum 7 minutes each time we left the hotel....The outside looks rundown....These were the good points....Now for the room itself...Ok when we first booked this trip we looked on trip advisor.com and took into consideration that some people said this hotel was OK and some said it was bad....So we didnt want to pass judgement until we got there...BOY we should have listened to the ones tha said it was bad! There are stains all over the carpet, the counter tops have old stains on them as well...Not to mention the fridge was dirty as hell....Now when we opened the dressers to unpack, there were dead roaches in the drawers, so needless to say we lived out of our suitcases for the week. The bathroom walls were disgusting...I was scared to touch the walls...There is a separate bedroom, but there is not TV in the room, only in the living room....Our agent told us there was a ocean view...Check out the pics to see our view...I have posted some pics of the hotel so that you can see for yourself how digusting this place really was....I warn you that this is NOT a good place to stay at all....Our agent told us that this hotel has been under renovation, but I am not sure just for how long it has been under renovation...But they need to hurry...STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!
reviews.title: DO NOT LET YOUR TRAVEL AGENT TALK YOU INTO STAYING HERE-

likes.disliked: — THe fact that it was dirty

reviews.text: Very unhappy!!!!!
reviews.title: The Bed Bugs made the Cockroaches look ok...

reviews.text: So there were 8 of us in 3 rooms. We had to switch rooms a total of 7 times. Reasons: Bedbugs, which bit my brother-in-law on the neck, back and arms, Cockroaches freely coming and going despite us being extra careful not leaving food/garbage bags open (yes I did tie the garbage bag most of the time, but did not work. My husband and our 2 kids had to be moved 3 times. We finally settled for a room with 1 double bed and one twin. When asked for what we had originally requested(Queen), we were told that all the rooms have a pull out sofa. Honestly, We were on vacation for 2 wks, Please don't expect me and my husband to sleep on the pull out sofa!
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.text: The rooms smelt like URINE. They were filthy. It was a good place to lose weight since the site of the roaches and the smell of urine was enough to suppress your appetite.
reviews.title: Glad I Selected This Hotel !

reviews.text: I went with my parents and sister. From the pictures on Expedia, we were expecting a slightly nicer hotel, but it wasn't too bad. We were on the 30th floor, so the views of the ocean and diamond head were spectacular. However, the booking got really screwed up. Our room was supposed to have 2 queen beds and a pull out couch, but instead they had a queen and single in the bedroom with a pull out couch in the living area. This means my parents would have to sleep with one teenager in their room, lol. The staff wasn't terribly helpful in finding us another room, so we ended up just dragging the single out into the living room so my parents could have some privacy.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

likes.liked: — Cheap, great views, and close to everything.

reviews.text: Some people say the rooms are disgusting, but not really. They are extremely outdated, but relatively clean the the housekeeping staff was great at keeping things nice and making sure we had everything we needed.
reviews.title: The Renovations has begun as promised!

reviews.text: There was a mention of cockroaches in another review and it should be said that you can't escape the little buggers. We only saw one in our room when it hitched a ride on a towel we had left to dry outside on the balcony. Yes I went screaming and running onto the bed because it was the largest bug I have ever seen, but they are common and my friends on the island say that you can't completely eradicate them.
reviews.title: Exactly what was expected - would come again!

reviews.text: They are everywhere, even in really lux housing. Get over it.
reviews.title: Large Rooms 4 Blocks From Beach

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is awesome. No big buildings blocking the view, and it is a short 2 minute walk to the beach. I didn;t mind how old the room looked because, let's face it, unless you're a honeymooner, you don't go to Hawaii to sit in your room. We found it perfunctory and useful for preparing breakfast and saving ourselves a bit of money. And despite what the manager keeps saying, the elevators ARE EXTREMELY SLOW. And no, most high rise hotels I have stayed at are faster than that. But over all, I enjoyed our stay and would stay again. Good deal for the money you pay.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

likes.liked: — Cheap, great views, and close to everything.

reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our 20th anniversary at this hotel with our 3 kids. It was the worst experience I've every had. One night when we came in late, my oldest daughter saw a COCKROACH running in the middle of our room! We called the help desk but just completely ignored us. For the last two days of our vacation, we weren't able to sleep because the kids feared that there were more COCKROACHES around. Expedia rated this as 3 star. This should be rated as 2 or even 1. Expedia should be held accounted for this lie. Oh before I forget, elevators are unbelievably slow. So, if you're rushing to get out/in, you'll have to wait for a very long time.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience at this Hotel

likes.liked: — We didn't like anything about it.
likes.disliked: — Where it's situated is surrounded by a broken down building, rooms are practically worn down and looks dirty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a lead on this from TravelZoo and booked the room for under $150. We only stayed one night as most of our trip was based on Kauai. We found the hotel, a couple of blocks back from the famous beach, was well located and the staff very friendly. This is a "condo" type of hotel and parts of the room (kitchen cabinets) are getting a little tired but the incredible view of Waikiki and Diamond Head more then made up for it. We had a balcony, a living room, kitchen area, bath and seperate bedroom. We were one block from the Honolulu zoo (which is worth going through) and just a short walk from the beach. Overall this was a great place to stay for one night and a real value for the money we spent!
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — Built in's are a little tired

reviews.text: This was our third year in a row staying at the RQ Waikiki Sunset, and loved it as usual. The staff was excellent , and we are already in the process of booking for Jan-Feb 2009. For us, the condo was great with a full sized kitchen, 2 bedrooms, and a living room for relaxing. The lanai had wonderful views of Diamond Head, and a partial view of the ocean. It was only a short walk to the beach, park, and many other activities Waikiki has to offer. Unlike previous years, we did not go to the grocery store and stock up on food, but the refrigerator came in handy for storing leftovers and water, while the microwave provided us a way to heat leftovers. Complimentary coffee is available in the morning, but you have to get there early. For the smokers, I like to smoke cigars, there is a smoking area in front of the hotel, and I believe on the 6th floor near the pool area. Another wonderful trip to paradise for me, and my crew. This is not a high end place, but I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a place to stay while enjoying this wonderful island.
reviews.title: My 2nd home

reviews.text: We had a two bedroom one bath. We stayed on the 29th floor, and had a corner room, so we had AMAZING views of the water and of Diamondhead...that was the best thing about this hotel. But It in some serious need of updating. It was clean, so I dont want to complain too much, but they really need invest some money and update things. We had a two bedroom, the bigger bedroom had a queen bed, no tv. My bedroom had a full bed, which was pretty comfortable, but the room was tiny...no tv, mirror, or dresser (just a nightstand and a closet) and my husband did not have room to get dressed in there at the same time. But we had a wall to ceiling window that faced the water, so the view from our room was phenomenal!
reviews.title: Good location, but needs updating

reviews.text: They have a great (but expensive) mini-mart on the 5th floor...it had a huge selection of stuff, and was super convenient (there is also an ABC store one block away); I never went to the pool.
reviews.title: Run for your life!

description: Enjoy spectacular views of Diamond Head, the blue Pacific, or the Honolulu city lights. Well-suited to families and centrally located in a quiet residential neighborhood just over one block from famous Waikiki beach, this resort offers relaxed island-style living in spacious one and two-bedroom suites with complete kitchens and private lanais.
